lines: 1. Depth of mercy!â€”can there be Mercy still reserved for me? Can my God His wrath forbear? Me, the chief of sinners, spare?
2. I have long withstood His grace, Long provoked Him to His face, Would not hearken to His calls, Grieved Him by a thousand falls.
3. Now incline me to repent; Let me now my sins lament; Now my foul revolt deplore, Weep, believe, and sin no more.
4. There for me the Saviour stands, Shows His wounds and spreads His hands; God is love! I know, I feel; Jesus weeps, and loves me still.
